cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to cross the NE Yucatan Peninsula, move over the central Gulf of Mexico, then turn north-northwest toward the upper Texas–south-west Louisiana coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas or southwest Louisiana coast (near Galveston Bay/Cameron area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Punta Herrero to Dzilam, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula then northern Gulf Coast from Texas through Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) with higher gusts possible late Tuesday into Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential storm surge 2–4 ft above ground level along the Upper Texas coast including Galveston Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could bring 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas and rip currents; isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands.
